turns.content: I need two input fields one is called MID and the other is called Descriptor. They are side by side in HTML.

You can create two input fields side by side in HTML using a combination of HTML and CSS. Here is an example of how to do it:
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
	<title>Two Input Fields Side by Side</title>
	<style>
		form {
			display: flex;
			flex-direction: row;
			align-items: center;
		}
		
		label {
			margin-right: 10px;
		}
	</style>
</head>
<body>
	<form>
		<label for="MID">MID:</label>
		<input type="text" id="MID" name="MID">
		<label for="Descriptor">Descriptor:</label>
		<input type="text" id="Descriptor" name="Descriptor">
	</form>
</body>
</html>
```
In this example, the form is styled using CSS `flexbox` to display the input fields side by side. The `label` element is used to provide a text label for each input field. The `for` attribute of the `label` element is used to associate the label with the corresponding input field using the `id` attribute.

You can modify the styling to suit your specific requirements.
Now I'd like to be able to press a button to clone those two input fields if the user needs to add more rows
Now how can I paste two columns from Excel into the first input fields and have it auto create more inputs based on the excel data I pasted
